TextBody:
Hello,

Thank you for reaching out !!!

Could you please provide us more details regarding this case. 

What EPP server / client version are you using? Do you use the DPI module ? 

Are you using any denylist for URLs or any allow list? 

Looking forward for your response.

Best regards,
__________________

Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #439271 -  - EPP issue for in-house sites. Its blocking sites.    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0N5lgz:ref ]

TextBody:
Hello Ashwin,

Thank you for your time in today's session.

In the meeting we have verified the EPP console and found that the EPP server version is at 5.7.0.0 .

As we discussed we recommend you to upgrade the server to the latest version. Here are the steps that can be use for the upgrade:

	Take a SNAPSHOT from your virtualisation environment
	Login to the EPP UI with and Admin user.
	Navigate to the dashboard menu -> select Live Update
	In the new window click on the Check for Updates
	Under the button you will find the update, check the checkbox next to it and below press the Apply Updates 
	Wait for the progress bar to finish and then refresh the entire tab
	Redo the steps starting with the Snapshot

Once you reach the latest version, please check if the situation persist. 

Looking forward for your response.

Best regards,
__________________
Daniel Anton | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | MDM | Device Control | Content Aware Protection
www.netwrix.com

TextBody:
Hello Ashwin,
I hope this message finds you well.

We're writing to inform you that, after three attempts to follow up with you regarding your issue with the indoor URLs that are blocked and upgrading the EPP server and client, we haven't received a response. We hope the solution or instructions provided have adequately addressed your needs.

Given the lack of communication, we will proceed with closing your incident case in our system. If you are still experiencing issues or require further assistance, please don't hesitate to reach out. We can quickly reopen your case and provide the necessary support.

Thank you for your understanding, and we appreciate the opportunity to assist you.

Please feel free to contact us at any time should you need further help in the future.
Have a nice day ahead!

Best regards,
__________________
Daniel Anton | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | MDM | Device Control | Content Aware Protection
www.netwrix.com

Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #439271 - - EPP issue for in-house sites. Its blocking sites. [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0N5lgz:ref ]
Hello Ashwin,

I hope this message finds you well.

We're writing to inform you that, after three attempts to follow up with you regarding your issue with the indoor URLs that are blocked and upgrading the EPP server and client, we haven't received a response. We hope the solution or instructions provided have adequately addressed your needs.

Given the lack of communication, we will proceed with closing your incident case in our system. If you are still experiencing issues or require further assistance, please don't hesitate to reach out. We can quickly reopen your case and provide the necessary support.

Thank you for your understanding, and we appreciate the opportunity to assist you.

Please feel free to contact us at any time should you need further help in the future.
Have a nice day ahead!

Best regards,
__________________

From: Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com>
Date: Thursday, 20 March 2025 at 4:13?PM
To: Ashwin Koli <ashwin.koli@cactusglobal.com>
Cc: CACTUS IT Support <itsupport@cactusglobal.com>
Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #439271 - - EPP issue for in-house sites. Its blocking sites. [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0N5lgz:ref ]
Hello Ashwin,

Thank you for your time in today's session.

In the meeting we have verified the EPP console and found that the EPP server version is at 5.7.0.0 .

As we discussed we recommend you to upgrade the server to the latest version. Here are the steps that can be use for the upgrade:

  *   Take a SNAPSHOT from your virtualisation environment
  *   Login to the EPP UI with and Admin user.
  *   Navigate to the dashboard menu -> select Live Update
  *   In the new window click on the Check for Updates
  *   Under the button you will find the update, check the checkbox next to it and below press the Apply Updates
  *   Wait for the progress bar to finish and then refresh the entire tab
  *   Redo the steps starting with the Snapshot
Once you reach the latest version, please check if the situation persist.

Looking forward for your response.

Best regards,
__________________
Daniel Anton | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | MDM | Device Control | Content Aware Protection
www.netwrix.com
